result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Zachary K. Zupon

records.addlTxt:
1:23 PM Defendant Zachary K. Zupon in court.  Attorney Russ S. Kort in court, via zoomfor Zachary K. Zupon.  Prosecuting attorney Kelly L Hays in court for the State of Wisconsin, via zoom.  Amended waiver form has been filed. Court goes over waiver of preliminary examination form with def. Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. Atty Kort is satisfied.  Court accepts waiver and finds probable cause and binds over.  Information filed electronically.  Atty Kort has copy of Information waives reading and enters Not Guilty plea to all ct's. Court receives Not Guilty plea on all counts. State is in compliance with victim rights. Bond continues.
Status conference scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Atty Kort has received and received criminal complaint with Def. and waives formal reading, waives prelim hearing and requests arraignment. Court would like to schedule for waiver of prelim hearing. Atty and Def. waive time limits. Court accepts waiver of time limits. Bond continues.
Waiver of Prelim scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

11:29 AM Defendant Zachary K. Zupon appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin. All parties via zoom.  Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given atty rights and given 3 options, PD, hire own or court appointed atty. Def. is going to retain counsel. State gives bail/bond recommendation with conditions No contact with victim 1 or victim 2 or their properties. Court orders $500 cash bond with condition No contact with victim 1 or victim 2 or their properties. State has complied with victim rights.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
